RE Western Gas Sales ConfirmationMichelle In reviewing the latest gas sale to WGR effective April I found that the referenced downstream contract CR that WGR would be using is not valid for April activity Dennis Lee confirmed that the contract is considered a Red Rock expansion request that may start in June Do you want me to contact WGR and have them change the contract that we handoff to WGR has contract set up for another gas sale effective April Let me know how you would like me to proceed Thanks Bert Original Message From Lokay Michelle Sent Friday March AM To Strohmeyer Vincent Moseley Debbie Moore Jan Hanagriff Richard Mulligan Amy Schoolcraft Darrell Cc Harris Steven Watson Kimberly Hernandez Bert Cherry Paul Subject Western Gas Sales Confirmation

VIRGINIA POWER PNRMichelle From our earlier conversation this is what probably happened to Virginias intended injection of at the Panhandle Pool PNR point for on PNR contract Virginia had already discussed this type of transaction meter bounce at NNGGray with Burlington since Amy Mulligan and Chris Miller worked with Greg and Hillary to inject gas back into the park n ride point for after their initial withdrawal on Amy informed the customer on how to nominate transaction type to create a bounce on the TW side of the station They miscalculated the fuel usage and had to do a second bounce on to balance their contract at that date Virginia again withdrew gas on their park n ride on with the intention to inject the gas on The problem appears to be that Burlington did their nomination for the Timely cycle but Virginia did not get their information into our system until pm which tagged it as an Evening cycle nom Chris Miller confirmed Burlington down to zero for the Timely cycle since Virginias contract did not appear on this cycle I do not know how Chris knew about this particular gas days transaction The TW late shift person did not know or forgot about the meter bounce so the two transactions did not get confirmed on the Evening cycle The scheduling system will not display any meter bounce information unless you specifically request the point AND the meter bounce filter Our usual procedure to review unconfirmed nominations is to select a blanknull point and the shipper nom filter It appears that meter bounces will not appear under this scenario Our system will also not show meter bounces by selecting a blanknull point and the meter bounce filter Our system does not have an all noms filter Since meter bounces are relatively rare in our system shippers are strongly encouraged to contact us when they submit a meter bounce nomination otherwise we do not look for them in the system I am working with Terry Kowalke to make meter bounces more visible to us but no one here is aware of any conversations with either Burlington or Virginia Power regarding the meter bounce for or any later date Please let me know if I can supply any further information Thanks Bert
TW WEEKENDHOLIDAY NOTES Cc Please see the attached file for the weekend and holiday period of through Mostly a quiet four days Seasons Greetings Bert

LAYOFFS Cc Lynn I talked to Patricia this morning and she and Marsha Hollis Shepherd are still working in EES for the next month or so With their extensive experience within the energy industry please keep them in mind if anything becomes available within ETS Thanks Bert
TW WEEKEND NOTES Cc Please see the attached notes for the weekend of November th and th Fairly quiet weekend Bert

RE K Invoices not capturing incremental fees for alternate points Cc Lynn In reviewing the Duke contract I did find that the rate was not correct for four months in the past year I also reviewed Duke contract since it also had the same type of alternate to California deal Two months on the second contract were not billed correctly If Marketing can input the correct rates into the system I can regenerate the invoices and bill Duke immediately Please see the attached file for details Thanks Bert Original Message From Blair Lynn Sent Monday September PM To Giambrone Laura Hernandez Bert McEvoy Christine Miller Beverly Miller Chris L Minter Tracy Mulligan Amy Ward Linda Cc Donoho Lindy Lohman TK Kowalke Terry Hanagriff Richard Subject FW K Invoices not capturing incremental fees for alternate points Team I realize this rate change is done in Marketing But you have a responsibility to review the invoice to ensure that the adjustment to the price has been made if there is alternate deliveries Lets be proactive to ensure we have accurate billing If you have any questions please let me know Original Message From Hanagriff Richard Sent Monday September AM To Blair Lynn Subject RE K Invoices not capturing incremental fees for alternate points This adjustment will result in approximately in additional revenues One way to prevent this situation in the future would be for the rep and or myself to ensure that Dukes rate has been increased when they have alternate deliveries to the border If these alternate deliveries exist and the rate has not been increased then the rep needs to bring this situation to the attention of the marketer Original Message From Brown Elizabeth Sent Saturday September PM To Watson Kimberly Blair Lynn Dietz Rick Donoho Lindy Subject K Invoices not capturing incremental fees for alternate points FYI In working to load rates for the FERC California reporting requirements it appears that for the last four months Duke Energy T M contract has not been billed the incremental fee of dth for alternate deliveries to the Cal Border over and above the base discount negotiated for the contracted primary points Please let me know if you have any questions Thanks Elizabeth x

DUKE INVOICES Cc The revised invoices for Duke contracts and appear to be correct The attached schedule shows the estimated revenue impact and the actual revised billing for both contracts The invoices are going out today to the customer along with an explanation for the change I will strive to capture the alternate deliveries to California calculation each month and forward the data to Lorraine and JanJeanette If you have any questions please let me know Thanks Bert

LATE NIGHT NOTES Cc ID Had to manually schedule Northwest CR PNM CR and TW CR because the receipt points were considered invalid The system EPSQd all the volumes down to I didnt have any problems with the Northwest or PNM contracts but I had to trace the TW admin contract all the way down the West Texas and Central pools I was able to reinstate a lot of the gas but Astras ended up at Socal and part of Richardsons gas ended up at Socal and PGE Sempras went to Calpine Reliant went to Southwest Gas Mojave and USGTs went to both Rio Puerco and Westar Ward so I fixed their volumes I had to manually fix Williams CR and Texacos CR due to variances at El Paso Blanco and Mojave respectively Williams was off by MMBtu while Texaco netted to zero West of Thoreau scheduled to and San Juan at I confirmed the scheduled volumes with Gas Control for all the points involved EVE Had to manually schedule the Northwest and PNM Hub contracts again I did not touch the gas sales on the admin contract Hopefully it will schedule in the NonGrid ANR is slightly off and one Northwest Receipt changed by on cycle The Northwest delivery from Milagro should schedule on the NonGrid I submitted the volumes to WFS as if they did schedule on the Evening NONGRID Confirmed down USGTs at Halley since NNG did not have a nomination in their system I got caught up trying to fix the Hub contracts that I did not notice the problem on the Evening cycle especially since Debra is working for the South end I nominated the payback volume on ANRs OBA for on the th as well as the th through nd I also confirmed the volumes for each day Check to make sure I am going in the right direction At least the system didnt get hung up during the confirmations like they did over the weekend If you need me on Tuesday call me at home or page me I plan to work Wednesday night unless someone tells me otherwise Bert

TW WEEKEND NOTES Cc Please see the attached file for the weekend notes of March thth We had problems with the confirmation phase of several cycles over the weekend Worked with Help Desk and Production Support to complete cycles Thanks Bert

FW Questar and Transwestern Outages April Cc Original Message From Pace Dawnell A DawnellA illiamscomENRON Sent Friday March PM To Hernandez Bert Subject FW Questar and Transwestern Outages April Bert Here is a copy of the notice posted on Northwest Pipelines EBB FYI Have A Nice Day Dawnell A Pace Marketing Services WGPWest Williams Phone Fax Original Message From Anderson James W Sent Friday March AM To WGPWSLC Shippers Subject Questar and Transwestern Outages Clay Basin Transwestern Outagedoc Clay Basin Transwestern Outagedoc

LATE NIGHT NOTES Cc ID The streak of nonvariances ended tonight One variance was intentional but the other was not In any case I had to manually schedule volumes at Transcolorado and Northwest for Sempras CR and respectively due to downstream confirmation cuts EVE All the points looked okay with the minor exception of Transcolorado OTHER The Force Majeure at Bisti looks like it will continue for to weeks Since San Juan will likely be cut every cycle we need to allocate the NGPL points Gray Eddy and Winkler even if San Juan does not appear on the original allocation list By allocating these points the bogus volume at Northwest delivery will disappear and then San Juan should come up for allocation I learned this the hard way by ignoring those points on the ID cycle for I knew the Enserco volumes were not going to be confirmed but the delivery at Northwest overinflated the deliveries at San Juan and should have been allocated The net effect was San Juan scheduled over even though Darrell had the capacity at For the good news Joe Hoang recached our batch printer options so now the J printer at is usable See you later Bert
